01-01.title: Vienna New Year's Concert
01-01.description: On January 1 each year, the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra performs its famous New Year's Concert at the Musikverein, broadcast to over 90 countries worldwide.

01-01.title: The Beatles' Last Live Performance
01-01.description: On January 1, 1969, The Beatles performed their last live concert on the rooftop of Apple Corps headquarters in London, famously captured in the 'Let It Be' film.

01-08.title: Elvis Presley's Birthday
01-08.description: January 8, 1935 marks the birth of Elvis Presley, celebrated annually at Graceland with candlelight vigils and musical tributes from fans worldwide.

01-08.title: David Bowie's Final Album Release
01-08.description: On January 8, 2016, David Bowie released his final studio album 'Blackstar' just two days before his death, receiving critical acclaim for its artistic depth.

01-15.title: Grammy Awards Nominations Concert
01-15.description: In mid-January, the Recording Academy typically holds its Grammy nominations concert, announcing categories for music's biggest awards ceremony.

01-22.title: Metallica's "One" Music Video Premiere
01-22.description: On January 22, 1989, Metallica's groundbreaking music video for 'One' premiered on MTV, becoming the first metal video to receive heavy rotation on the channel.

01-27.title: Mozart's Birthday
01-27.description: January 27, 1756 marks the birth of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart in Salzburg, Austria, celebrated worldwide with special concerts and performances of his works.

01-27.title: The Recording of "We Are the World"
01-27.description: On January 27, 1985, over 40 American music icons gathered to record 'We Are the World' to raise funds for African famine relief.

02-01.title: Grammy Awards Ceremony
02-01.description: The Grammy Awards typically take place in early February, with February 1, 2009 marking the ceremony where Robert Plant & Alison Krauss won Album of the Year.

02-03.title: Buddy Holly's Death
02-03.description: February 3, 1959 marks 'The Day the Music Died' when Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. Richardson died in a plane crash, immortalized in Don McLean's 'American Pie'.

02-05.title: Bob Marley's Final Concert
02-05.description: On February 5, 1980, Bob Marley performed his final concert at the Stanley Theater in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, before his death in 1981.

02-05.title: The Beatles Record "Please Please Me"
02-05.description: On February 5, 1963, The Beatles recorded their first UK chart-topper 'Please Please Me' at Abbey Road Studios.

02-05.title: Michael Jackson's "Thriller" Video Premiere
02-05.description: On February 5, 1984, Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' music video received its first MTV premiere in its full 14-minute version.

02-07.title: The Beatles Arrive in America
02-07.description: On February 7, 1964, The Beatles arrived at New York's John F. Kennedy Airport, greeted by thousands of screaming fans and beginning the British Invasion.

02-09.title: The Beatles Debut on The Ed Sullivan Show
02-09.description: On February 9, 1964, The Beatles made their American television debut on The Ed Sullivan Show, performing for an estimated 73 million viewers and helping ignite the "British Invasion" in popular music.

02-11.title: Nelson Mandela's Release Concert
02-11.description: On February 11, 1990, a massive concert was held at Wembley Stadium celebrating Nelson Mandela's release from prison, featuring numerous international music stars.

02-14.title: Whitney Houston's Debut Album Released
02-14.description: On February 14, 1985, Whitney Houston's self-titled debut album was released. It spent 14 weeks at number one on the Billboard 200 and launched one of the best-selling music careers of all time.

02-20.title: Kurt Cobain and Courtney Love Wedding
02-20.description: On February 20, 1992, Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain married Hole frontwoman Courtney Love in a small ceremony in Hawaii.

02-24.title: The Rolling Stones' First Concert
02-24.description: On February 24, 1963, The Rolling Stones performed their first concert at the Crawdaddy Club in Richmond, London, beginning their journey to rock stardom.

02-25.title: George Harrison's "My Sweet Lord" Lawsuit Ruling
02-25.description: On February 25, 1976, a court ruled that George Harrison's 'My Sweet Lord' had unconsciously plagiarized The Chiffons' 'He's So Fine'.

02-26.title: Bob Dylan's First Recording Session
02-26.description: On February 26, 1962, Bob Dylan recorded his first album for Columbia Records, marking the beginning of his legendary recording career.

02-27.title: Michael Jackson Wins 8 Grammys
02-27.description: On February 27, 1984, Michael Jackson won a record 8 Grammy Awards in one night for his album 'Thriller'.

03-01.title: The Beatles Begin Recording "Please Please Me" Album
03-01.description: On March 1, 1963, The Beatles began recording their debut album 'Please Please Me' at Abbey Road Studios, completing it in just one day.

03-03.title: The Day Music Went Digital
03-03.description: On March 3, 1983, the first compact disc players went on sale in the United States, revolutionizing how people listened to music.

03-06.title: Bob Marley's Final Concert in Jamaica
03-06.description: On March 6, 1981, Bob Marley performed his final concert in his homeland of Jamaica at the National Arena in Kingston.

03-09.title: The Beatles Release "Let It Be" Single
03-09.description: On March 9, 1970, The Beatles released 'Let It Be' as a single in the UK, becoming one of their most enduring and beloved songs.

03-14.title: Billboard Hot 100 Dominance
03-14.description: On March 14, 1964, The Beatles occupied the top three spots on the Billboard Hot 100 with 'I Want to Hold Your Hand,' 'She Loves You,' and 'Please Please Me'.

03-16.title: The Beatles' "Help!" Film Premiere
03-16.description: On March 16, 1965, The Beatles' second film 'Help!' premiered in London, featuring the soundtrack that included classic songs like 'Ticket to Ride' and 'Yesterday'.

03-20.title: Spring Equinox Music Festivals Begin
03-20.description: Around March 20, many spring music festivals worldwide begin their seasons, including South by Southwest (SXSW) in Austin, Texas.

03-22.title: The Beatles Release "With the Beatles"
03-22.description: On March 22, 1964, The Beatles released their second UK album 'With the Beatles,' which spent 21 weeks at number one on the charts.

03-25.title: Elton John's "Candle in the Wind 1997" Release
03-25.description: On March 25, 1997, Elton John released the single version of 'Candle in the Wind 1997,' which would become the best-selling single of all time.

03-26.title: Diana Ross's Final Supremes Concert
03-26.description: On March 26, 1970, Diana Ross performed her final concert with The Supremes at the Frontier Hotel in Las Vegas before embarking on her solo career.

03-28.title: Live Aid Announcement
03-28.description: On March 28, 1985, Bob Geldof announced plans for the Live Aid concerts, which would become one of the largest-scale television events and charity concerts in history.

03-30.title: The Beatles Break Up
03-30.description: On March 30, 1970, Paul McCartney announced he was leaving The Beatles, effectively marking the end of the legendary band.

03-31.title: Eurovision Song Contest National Selections
03-31.description: Late March marks the conclusion of many national selection competitions for the Eurovision Song Contest, with countries choosing their representatives for the May competition.

04-01.title: Bob Dylan receives his Nobel Prize for Literature at a
04-01.description: On April 1, 2017, Bob Dylan receives his Nobel Prize for Literature at a private ceremony in Stockholm

04-02.title: Fleetwood Mac 's "Rumours" album goes to No. 1 and
04-02.description: On April 2, 1977, Fleetwood Mac 's "Rumours" album goes to No. 1 and stays atop the charts for 31 weeks

04-03.title: Elvis Presley records ‘It's Now Or Never’
04-03.description: On April 3, 1960, Elvis Presley records ‘It's Now Or Never’, ‘Fever’ and ‘Are You Lonesome Tonight’ at RCA studios in Nashville, Tennessee

04-04.title: Stephen Sondheim 's "Follies" opens at Winter Garden
04-04.description: On April 4, 1971, Stephen Sondheim 's "Follies" opens at Winter Garden Theater, NYC; runs for 524 performances, then most expensive Broadway musical at the time

04-05.title: Johann Strauss Jr's opera "Die Fledermaus" premieres
04-05.description: On April 5, 1874, Johann Strauss Jr's opera "Die Fledermaus" premieres in Vienna

04-06.title: ABBA for Sweden wins singing "Waterloo" in Brighton
04-06.description: On April 6, 1974, 19th Eurovision Song Contest: ABBA for Sweden wins singing "Waterloo" in Brighton, England

04-07.title: Johann Sebastian Bach 's "St John Passion" premieres
04-07.description: On April 7, 1724, Johann Sebastian Bach 's "St John Passion" premieres on Good Friday at St. Nicholas Church in Leipzig, Electorate of Saxony (now Germany)

04-08.title: Amilcare Ponchielli's opera "La Gioconda" premieres in
04-08.description: On April 8, 1876, Amilcare Ponchielli's opera "La Gioconda" premieres in Milan

04-09.title: "The Lion King" becomes highest grossing Broadway show
04-09.description: On April 9, 2012, "The Lion King" becomes highest grossing Broadway show, overtaking "The Phantom of the Opera"

04-10.title: Paul McCartney officially announces the breakup of The
04-10.description: On April 10, 1970, Paul McCartney officially announces the breakup of The Beatles in a press release promoting his solo album

04-11.title: Jack Slack retains the Champion of England boxing
04-11.description: On April 11, 1750, Jack Slack retains the Champion of England boxing title after defeating Frenchman Jean Petit in 7 rounds in Harlston, England, acknowledged as the first international prizefight

04-12.title: Bill Haley & His Comets record "Rock Around the Clock"
04-12.description: On April 12, 1954, Bill Haley & His Comets record "Rock Around the Clock"

04-13.title: George Frideric Handel 's oratorio "Messiah" is
04-13.description: On April 13, 1742, George Frideric Handel 's oratorio "Messiah" is performed for the first time at the New Music Hall in Dublin

04-14.title: Metallica files a lawsuit against the peer-to-peer
04-14.description: On April 14, 2000, Metallica files a lawsuit against the peer-to-peer sharing platform Napster, accelerating a movement against file-sharing programs

04-15.title: Johann Sebastian Bach 's "St Matthew Passion"
04-15.description: On April 15, 1729, Johann Sebastian Bach 's "St Matthew Passion" premieres at the Thomaskirche in Leipzig, Holy Roman Empire (now Germany)

04-16.title: Giacomo Meyerbeer's opera "Le prophète" premieres in
04-16.description: On April 16, 1849, Giacomo Meyerbeer's opera "Le prophète" premieres in Paris

04-17.title: Paul McCartney releases his first solo album
04-17.description: On April 17, 1970, Paul McCartney releases his first solo album "McCartney"

04-18.title: "Wham!" become the first western pop act to release an
04-18.description: On April 18, 1985, "Wham!" become the first western pop act to release an album in China

04-19.title: Johnny Cash releases single "Ring of Fire" written by
04-19.description: On April 19, 1963, Johnny Cash releases single "Ring of Fire" written by his future wife June Carter and Merle Kilgore

04-20.title: John Philip Sousa 's operetta "El Capitan" premieres
04-20.description: On April 20, 1896, John Philip Sousa 's operetta "El Capitan" premieres on Broadway at Broadway Theatre, NYC

04-21.title: Elvis Presley 's first hit record
04-21.description: On April 21, 1956, Elvis Presley 's first hit record, "Heartbreak Hotel," reaches #1

04-22.title: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky completes his ballet "Swan
04-22.description: On April 22, 1876, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky completes his ballet "Swan Lake"

04-23.title: Singer Judy Garland appears in concert at Carnegie Hall
04-23.description: On April 23, 1961, Singer Judy Garland appears in concert at Carnegie Hall, NYC; the event is recorded for a double live album and wins a Grammy Award for Album of the Year, the first by a female artist

04-24.title: Streaming music services overtake worldwide sales of
04-24.description: On April 24, 2018, Streaming music services overtake worldwide sales of CDs and vinyl for the first time according to IFPI

04-25.title: Giacomo Puccini 's opera "Turandot" premieres in Milan
04-25.description: On April 25, 1926, Giacomo Puccini 's opera "Turandot" premieres in Milan

04-26.title: Charles Ives ' 4th Symphony premieres at Carnegie Hall
04-26.description: On April 26, 1965, Charles Ives ' 4th Symphony premieres at Carnegie Hall, New York, 11 years after the composer's death

04-27.title: Ludwig van Beethoven composes his famous piano piece
04-27.description: On April 27, 1810, Ludwig van Beethoven composes his famous piano piece "Für Elise"

04-28.title: Glenn Miller records the song "Pennsylvania 6-5000" in
04-28.description: On April 28, 1940, Glenn Miller records the song "Pennsylvania 6-5000" in NYC; tune is named after phone number of the Hotel Pennsylvania in Manhattan

04-29.title: Aretha Franklin releases her single "Respect"
04-29.description: On April 29, 1967, Aretha Franklin releases her single "Respect" (written by Otis Redding ), Billboard Song of the Year 1967

04-30.title: Claude Debussy 's only completed opera "Pelléas et
04-30.description: On April 30, 1902, Claude Debussy 's only completed opera "Pelléas et Mélisande" premieres at the Salle Favart in Paris, performed by the Opéra-Comique and conducted by André Messager

05-01.title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's opera "The Marriage of
05-01.description: On May 1, 1786, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's opera "The Marriage of Figaro" premieres in Vienna with Mozart himself conducting

05-02.title: Sergei Prokofiev 's musical "Peter and the Wolf"
05-02.description: On May 2, 1936, Sergei Prokofiev 's musical "Peter and the Wolf" premieres in Moscow

05-03.title: Musical "The Fantasticks" by Harvey Schmidt and Tom
05-03.description: On May 3, 1960, Musical "The Fantasticks" by Harvey Schmidt and Tom Jones opens in Greenwich Village, NYC, becomes “the longest-running musical in the universe”

05-03.title: Lady Gaga 's free concert at Copacabana Beach in Rio
05-03.description: On May 3, 2025, Lady Gaga 's free concert at Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, draws crowd estimated at 2.5 million attendees, the largest concert in history for a female artist; police later reveal they thwarted a bombing attempt

05-04.title: Perry Como and Ella Fitzgerald win major awards
05-04.description: On May 4, 1959, First Grammy Awards: Perry Como and Ella Fitzgerald win major awards

05-05.title: Music Hall (now Carnegie Hall) opens in New York City
05-05.description: On May 5, 1891, Music Hall (now Carnegie Hall) opens in New York City, with Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky as guest conductor of the New York Music Society Orchestra

05-06.title: The Rolling Stones release the single "Paint It Black"
05-06.description: On May 6, 1966, The Rolling Stones release the single "Paint It Black" in the US, featuring prominent sitar music played by Brian Jones

05-07.title: Ludwig van Beethoven 's 9th (Choral) Symphony
05-07.description: On May 7, 1824, Ludwig van Beethoven 's 9th (Choral) Symphony, often regarded as his greatest work, with libretto by poet Friedrich von Schiller, premieres at the Theater am Kärntnertor in Vienna, Austria [1]

05-08.title: The Cure release their debut album "Three Imaginary
05-08.description: On May 8, 1979, The Cure release their debut album "Three Imaginary Boys" (Boys Don't Cry in US, Australia)

05-09.title: The Beatles sign their first contract with EMI
05-09.description: On May 9, 1962, The Beatles sign their first contract with EMI Parlophone

05-09.title: George Harrison 's "Here Comes the Sun" becomes the
05-09.description: On May 9, 2023, George Harrison 's "Here Comes the Sun" becomes the first Beatles song to register a billion streams on Spotify; it is also the oldest song to do so

05-10.title: Decca Records signs The Rolling Stones on the advice
05-10.description: On May 10, 1963, Decca Records signs The Rolling Stones on the advice of Beatles guitarist George Harrison [1]

05-11.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber 's musical "Cats" directed by
05-11.description: On May 11, 1981, Andrew Lloyd Webber 's musical "Cats" (based on poetry by T. S. Eliot ) directed by Trevor Nunn, opens at the New London Theatre in the West End, London; runs for 8,949 performances

05-12.title: Track Records releases "Are You Experienced" album by
05-12.description: On May 12, 1967, Track Records releases "Are You Experienced" album by the Jimi Hendrix Experience - one of the most influential debut albums ever

05-13.title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's first opera "Apollo et
05-13.description: On May 13, 1767, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's first opera "Apollo et Hyacinthus", written when he was 11 years old, premieres in Salzburg

05-14.title: Felix Mendelssohn 's concert overture "Hebrides"
05-14.description: On May 14, 1832, Felix Mendelssohn 's concert overture "Hebrides" premieres in London, England

05-15.title: Henri Rabaud's opera "Mârouf
05-15.description: On May 15, 1914, Henri Rabaud's opera "Mârouf, savetier du Caire" (Marouf, the Cairo Cobbler) premieres in Paris

05-16.title: First Chess World Championship since WWII
05-16.description: On May 16, 1948, First Chess World Championship since WWII, Russian player Mikhail Botvinnik wins a five-player tournament to begin 24 years of Soviet dominance

05-16.title: NBA Chicago Bulls forward Michael Jordan is named NBA
05-16.description: On May 16, 1985, NBA Chicago Bulls forward Michael Jordan is named NBA Rookie of the Year

05-17.title: "Blurryface," 4th studio album by Twenty One Pilots is
05-17.description: On May 17, 2015, "Blurryface," 4th studio album by Twenty One Pilots is released (1st album ever to have every track gold-certified)

05-18.title: "Millennium" 3rd studio album by the Backstreet Boys
05-18.description: On May 18, 1999, "Millennium" 3rd studio album by the Backstreet Boys is released - one of the best-selling albums of all time with over 30 million copies sold

05-19.title: Rodgers and Hammerstein 's "South Pacific" soundtrack
05-19.description: On May 19, 1958, Rodgers and Hammerstein 's "South Pacific" soundtrack album goes #1 and stays #1 for 31 weeks

05-20.title: "Every Breath You Take" single released by The Police
05-20.description: On May 20, 1983, "Every Breath You Take" single released by The Police (Billboard Song of the Year, 1983)

05-21.title: Reggae musician Bob Marley receives a Jamaican state
05-21.description: On May 21, 1981, Reggae musician Bob Marley receives a Jamaican state funeral

05-22.title: American inventor Edwin S. Votey receives a patent for
05-22.description: On May 22, 1900, American inventor Edwin S. Votey receives a patent for the pneumatic piano player

05-23.title: Eminem releases his third studio album "The Marshall
05-23.description: On May 23, 2000, Eminem releases his third studio album "The Marshall Mathers LP," the fastest-selling studio album ever (Grammy - Best Rap Album, 2001)

05-24.title: Lys Assia for Switzerland wins singing "Refrain" in
05-24.description: On May 24, 1956, 1st Eurovision Song Contest: Lys Assia for Switzerland wins singing "Refrain" in Lugano

05-25.title: W. S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan 's comic opera
05-25.description: On May 25, 1878, W. S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan 's comic opera "H.M.S. Pinafore" premieres in London, their first international success

05-26.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band 1967 EMI rush
05-26.description: On May 26, 1967, Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band 1967 EMI rush releases The Beatles' album " Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band " in London and select markets in the UK, goes to #1 for 22 weeks in the UK and 15 weeks in the US

05-27.title: The Sex Pistols release "God Save the Queen
05-27.description: On May 27, 1977, The Sex Pistols release "God Save the Queen," sparking major controversy and leading to a ban on the song by the BBC

05-27.title: South Korean boy band BTS are the first K-pop group to
05-27.description: On May 27, 2018, South Korean boy band BTS are the first K-pop group to top the US Billboard 200 with their album "Love Yourself: Tear"

05-28.title: Rock guitarist Slash first hears Axl Rose singing with
05-28.description: On May 28, 1983, Rock guitarist Slash first hears Axl Rose singing with the band Rapidfire at Gazzarri’s On The Sunset Strip, in Los Angeles, California

05-29.title: Bing Crosby records Irving Berlin 's song "White
05-29.description: On May 29, 1942, Bing Crosby records Irving Berlin 's song "White Christmas" with the John Scott Trotter Orchestra and the Ken Darby Singers in just 18 minutes; it becomes the world's best-selling single, with an estimated 100 million copies sold

05-30.title: Jazz standard "Darktown Strutters' Ball" by Shelton
05-30.description: On May 30, 1917, Jazz standard "Darktown Strutters' Ball" by Shelton Brooks is recorded by the Original Dixieland Jazz Band

05-31.title: Rihanna releases her breakthrough album "Good Girl
05-31.description: On May 31, 2007, Rihanna releases her breakthrough album "Good Girl Gone Bad"

06-01.title: Simon & Garfunkel's single "Mrs. Robinson" from "The
06-01.description: On June 1, 1968, Simon & Garfunkel's single "Mrs. Robinson" from "The Graduate" hits #1 (first rock song to win a Grammy for Record of the Year)

06-02.title: Ray Charles ' cover of Don Gibson's "I Can't Stop
06-02.description: On June 2, 1962, Ray Charles ' cover of Don Gibson's "I Can't Stop Loving You", from his influential crossover album "Modern Sounds in Country and Western Music" hits #1 on Billboard

06-03.title: Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" goes gold
06-03.description: On June 3, 1976, Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" goes gold

06-04.title: Columbia Records releases Bruce Springsteen 's seventh
06-04.description: On June 4, 1984, Columbia Records releases Bruce Springsteen 's seventh studio album "Born in the USA," his biggest commercial success that topped the charts in 11 countries and sold over 30 million copies worldwide

06-05.title: Benjamin Britten 's opera "Peter Grimes" premieres in
06-05.description: On June 5, 1945, Benjamin Britten 's opera "Peter Grimes" premieres in London

06-06.title: "Storms of Life" debut album by Randy Travis is
06-06.description: On June 6, 1986, "Storms of Life" debut album by Randy Travis is released (Billboard Album of the Year, 1987)

06-07.title: Jim Jacobs and Warren Casey's musical "Grease
06-07.description: On June 7, 1972, Jim Jacobs and Warren Casey's musical "Grease," starring Barry Bostwick, Carole Demas, and Adrienne Barbeau, opens at the Broadhurst Theatre in NYC; runs for 3,388 performances

06-08.title: Drag queen RuPaul releases his debut album "Supermodel
06-08.description: On June 8, 1993, Drag queen RuPaul releases his debut album "Supermodel of the World"

06-09.title: "Jelly-Roll Blues" is recorded by American jazz
06-09.description: On June 9, 1924, "Jelly-Roll Blues" is recorded by American jazz pioneer pianist and composer Jelly Roll Morton

06-10.title: Richard Wagner 's opera "Tristan und Isolde" (Tristan
06-10.description: On June 10, 1865, Richard Wagner 's opera "Tristan und Isolde" (Tristan and Isolde) premieres in Munich, Germany

06-11.title: NY Times reports that an estimated 500
06-11.description: On June 11, 2019, NY Times reports that an estimated 500,000 song titles, including masters of Chuck Berry, Louis Armstrong, and Ella Fitzgerald, were lost in a 2008 warehouse fire on Universal backlot in Los Angeles

06-12.title: Mariah Carey 's self-titled debut album is released
06-12.description: On June 12, 1990, Mariah Carey 's self-titled debut album is released

06-13.title: Björk releases her second art pop solo album "Post"
06-13.description: On June 13, 1995, Björk releases her second art pop solo album "Post"

06-14.title: Recording of first country music hit
06-14.description: On June 14, 1923, Recording of first country music hit (Little Old Log Cabin in the Lane)

06-15.title: Bob Dylan records the single "Like a Rolling Stone"
06-15.description: On June 15, 1965, Bob Dylan records the single "Like a Rolling Stone" (#1 in Rolling Stone magazine's "500 Greatest Songs of All Time")

06-16.title: "The Wizard of Oz" musical first opens in Chicago
06-16.description: On June 16, 1902, "The Wizard of Oz" musical first opens in Chicago, Illinois

06-16.title: RCA releases David Bowie 's fifth studio album "The
06-16.description: On June 16, 1972, RCA releases David Bowie 's fifth studio album "The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars,"; considered his artistic breakthrough

06-17.title: Carole King 's album "Tapestry" goes to #1 on US album
06-17.description: On June 17, 1971, Carole King 's album "Tapestry" goes to #1 on US album charts and stays there for 15 weeks

06-18.title: "(Everything I Do) I Do It for You" single released by
06-18.description: On June 18, 1991, "(Everything I Do) I Do It for You" single released by Bryan Adams (Billboard Song of the Year, 1991)

06-19.title: Loretta Lynn records "I'm a Honky Tonk Girl"
06-19.description: On June 19, 1960, Loretta Lynn records "I'm a Honky Tonk Girl"

06-20.title: 200,000 attend Newport '69, then largest-ever pop
06-20.description: On June 20, 1969, 200,000 attend Newport '69, then largest-ever pop concert in Northridge, California. Jimi Hendrix paid $120,000 to perform.

06-21.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice 's musical "Evita
06-21.description: On June 21, 1978, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice 's musical "Evita," starring Elaine Paige, premieres at the Prince Edward Theatre in London

06-22.title: "Little" Stevie Wonder aged 13 releases his first
06-22.description: On June 22, 1963, "Little" Stevie Wonder aged 13 releases his first single "Fingertips" (first live non-studio recording to go to No. 1 on Billboard)

06-23.title: Supertramp's "Breakfast in America" becomes No. 1
06-23.description: On June 23, 1979, Supertramp's "Breakfast in America" becomes No. 1 album in the US featuring "Take the Long Way Home"

06-23.title: Britney Spears requests a judge to end her
06-23.description: On June 23, 2021, Britney Spears requests a judge to end her court-ordered conservatorship, stating, "I think this conservatorship is abusive. I don't think I can live a full life."

06-24.title: First performance of "O Canada
06-24.description: On June 24, 1880, First performance of "O Canada," the song that would become the national anthem of Canada, at the Congrès national des Canadiens-Français

06-25.title: Warner Bros Records releases the sixth studio album by
06-25.description: On June 25, 1984, Warner Bros Records releases the sixth studio album by Prince, " Purple Rain "; his commercial peak, the film soundtrack album sells over 25 million copies, tops the charts in five countries, and wins two Grammy Awards and an Academy Award

06-26.title: Richard Wagner 's opera "Die Walküre" (The Valkyrie)
06-26.description: On June 26, 1870, Richard Wagner 's opera "Die Walküre" (The Valkyrie), the second in his Ring Cycle, premieres in Munich, featuring "Ride of the Valkyries"

06-27.title: Aerosmith is the first major band to let fans download
06-27.description: On June 27, 1994, Aerosmith is the first major band to let fans download a full new track for free from the internet

06-28.title: Louis Armstrong makes a 78 rpm recording of "West End
06-28.description: On June 28, 1928, Louis Armstrong makes a 78 rpm recording of "West End Blues"

06-29.title: First known recording of classical music is made
06-29.description: On June 29, 1888, First known recording of classical music is made, Handel's "Israel in Egypt" on wax cylinder

06-30.title: "End of the Road" single released by Boyz II Men
06-30.description: On June 30, 1992, "End of the Road" single released by Boyz II Men (Grammy Award Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals and Best R&B Song 1993, Billboard Song of the Year 1992)

07-01.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band 1967 The
07-01.description: On July 1, 1967, Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band 1967 The Beatles' album " Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band " goes to #1 in the United States and stays there for 15 weeks

07-02.title: Live 8 concerts held around the world organised by Bob
07-02.description: On July 2, 2005, Live 8 concerts held around the world organised by Bob Geldof to raise awareness of poverty

07-03.title: Cardi B is the first female rapper to achieve two #1
07-03.description: On July 3, 2018, Cardi B is the first female rapper to achieve two #1 hits on the US Billboard chart with "I Like It" featuring Bad Bunny and J Balvin

07-04.title: "America " with lyrics by Samuel Francis Smith has its
07-04.description: On July 4, 1831, "America (My Country 'Tis of Thee)" with lyrics by Samuel Francis Smith has its first public performance at Park Street Church in Boston, Massachusetts

07-05.title: At Knebworth Festival in England
07-05.description: On July 5, 1975, At Knebworth Festival in England, Pink Floyd debut their album "Wish You Were Here" with pyrotechnics and an exploding plane that flies into the stage

07-06.title: John Lennon (16) and Paul McCartney (15) meet for the
07-06.description: On July 6, 1957, John Lennon (16) and Paul McCartney (15) meet for the first time as Lennon's rock group, the Quarrymen, perform at St. Peter's Woolton Parish Church in Liverpool; mutual friend Ivan Vaughn introduces them

07-07.title: First 'Three Tenors' concert featuring Plácido Domingo
07-07.description: On July 7, 1990, First 'Three Tenors' concert featuring Plácido Domingo, José Carreras and Luciano Pavarotti at Baths of Caracalla in Rome; recording becomes world's best-selling classical record

07-08.title: British girl group the Spice Girls release their debut
07-08.description: On July 8, 1996, British girl group the Spice Girls release their debut single "Wannabe" in the UK

07-09.title: Bill Haley & His Comets' "Rock Around the Clock" tops
07-09.description: On July 9, 1955, Bill Haley & His Comets' "Rock Around the Clock" tops the Billboard chart as one of the best-selling singles ever

07-10.title: Drake surpasses The Beatles' record of most singles in
07-10.description: On July 10, 2018, Drake surpasses The Beatles' record of most singles in the Billboard Hot 100 with seven from his album "Scorpion" against their five

07-11.title: David Bowie releases the single "Space Oddity" nine
07-11.description: On July 11, 1969, David Bowie releases the single "Space Oddity" nine days before Apollo 11 lands on the moon

07-12.title: Rolling Stones' first performance at the Marquee Club
07-12.description: On July 12, 1962, Rolling Stones' first performance at the Marquee Club in London

07-13.title: RCA releases Elvis Presley 's single "Hound Dog
07-13.description: On July 13, 1956, RCA releases Elvis Presley 's single "Hound Dog," a cover of Big Mama Thornton's original, written by Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller, backed with "Don't Be Cruel," written by Otis Blackwell

07-13.title: Live Aid concerts held at both Wembley Stadium
07-13.description: On July 13, 1985, Live Aid concerts held at both Wembley Stadium (London) and JFK Stadium (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania) raise over $70 million for African famine relief

07-14.title: French National Convention decrees "La Marseillaise"
07-14.description: On July 14, 1795, French National Convention decrees "La Marseillaise" by Claude-Joseph Rouget de Lisle as France's national anthem

07-15.title: "Honky Chateau" becomes Elton John 's first No. 1
07-15.description: On July 15, 1972, "Honky Chateau" becomes Elton John 's first No. 1 album in the US, includes hit "Rocket Man"

07-16.title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's opera "Die Entführung aus
07-16.description: On July 16, 1782, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 's opera "Die Entführung aus dem Serail (The Abduction from the Seraglio)" premieres in Vienna with Mozart conducting

07-17.title: George Frideric Handel 's "Water Music" premieres
07-17.description: On July 17, 1717, George Frideric Handel 's "Water Music" premieres repeatedly on a barge cruising the River Thames in London

07-18.title: Billy Joel 's "Glass Houses" album tops US charts
07-18.description: On July 18, 1980, Billy Joel 's "Glass Houses" album tops US charts, featuring "It's Still Rock 'n' Roll to Me"

07-19.title: Billboard publishes its earliest known chart
07-19.description: On July 19, 1913, Billboard publishes its earliest known chart, "Last Week's 10 Best Sellers Among Popular Songs." The #1 song is "Malinda's Wedding Day" by singers Byron Harlan and Arthur Collins, recorded in Camden, New Jersey.

07-20.title: Columbia records release Bob Dylan single "Like a
07-20.description: On July 20, 1965, Columbia records release Bob Dylan single "Like a Rolling Stone" [1]

07-21.title: Pink Floyd 's "The Wall" is performed where the Berlin
07-21.description: On July 21, 1990, Pink Floyd 's "The Wall" is performed where the Berlin Wall once stood in a charity concert led by Roger Waters, with guests Cyndi Lauper, Joni Mitchell, The Scorpions, Sinéad O'Connor, Bryan Adams, The Band, Van Morrison, The Hooters, and others

07-22.title: Caterina Jarboro sings "Aida" at the New York
07-22.description: On July 22, 1933, Caterina Jarboro sings "Aida" at the New York Hippodrome, becoming the first Black female opera singer to perform in the United States

07-23.title: Frank Sinatra 's album "Strangers in the Night" hits
07-23.description: On July 23, 1966, Frank Sinatra 's album "Strangers in the Night" hits #1 on the US charts and wins a Grammy for Record of the Year and Best Male Vocal Performance

07-24.title: Single "Eye of the Tiger" by Survivor from "Rocky III"
07-24.description: On July 24, 1982, Single "Eye of the Tiger" by Survivor from "Rocky III" soundtrack starts a 6-week run at #1 on US charts (Grammy for Best Rock Performance)

07-24.title: Singer-songwriter icon Joni Mitchell makes a surprise
07-24.description: On July 24, 2022, Singer-songwriter icon Joni Mitchell makes a surprise concert appearance, joining Brandi Carlile at Newport Folk Festival in Mitchell's first public performance in 19 years

07-25.title: Bob Dylan is booed by sections of the crowd at the
07-25.description: On July 25, 1965, Bob Dylan is booed by sections of the crowd at the Newport Folk Festival for performing with an electric guitar, beginning the era of folk rock

07-25.description: On July 25, 1975, Marvin Hamlisch and Edward Kleban's musical "A Chorus Line" opens at the Shubert Theatre in NYC, setting a record for the longest-running Broadway show with 6,137 performances and winning 10 Tony Awards

07-26.title: Richard Wagner 's opera "Parsifal" premieres in
07-26.description: On July 26, 1882, Richard Wagner 's opera "Parsifal" premieres in Bayreuth, Germany

07-27.title: Billboard publishes its first singles record chart;
07-27.description: On July 27, 1940, Billboard publishes its first singles record chart; "I'll Never Smile Again" by Tommy Dorsey, with vocals by Frank Sinatra, is ranked #1

07-27.title: Alan Menken and Howard Ashman's musical "Little Shop
07-27.description: On July 27, 1982, Alan Menken and Howard Ashman's musical "Little Shop of Horrors" opens Off-Broadway at the Orpheum Theatre in NYC

07-28.title: Foxtrot is first danced at the New Amsterdam Roof
07-28.description: On July 28, 1914, Foxtrot is first danced at the New Amsterdam Roof Garden in New York City by Harry Fox

07-28.title: 600,000 attend the "Summer Jam" rock festival
07-28.description: On July 28, 1973, 600,000 attend the "Summer Jam" rock festival featuring The Grateful Dead, The Band, and The Allman Brothers Band at Watkins Glen, New York, at the time the largest ever audience at a pop festival

07-29.title: Led Zeppelin has over $200
07-29.description: On July 29, 1973, Led Zeppelin has over $200,000 in cash stolen from a safe deposit box at the New York Hilton Hotel

07-30.title: Elvis Presley joins the Memphis Federation of
07-30.description: On July 30, 1954, Elvis Presley joins the Memphis Federation of Musicians Local 71

07-31.title: Cliff Richard and the Shadows have their first British
07-31.description: On July 31, 1959, Cliff Richard and the Shadows have their first British #1 single with "Living Doll," the best-selling British single of 1959

08-01.title: XI Summer Olympic Games are opened by Adolf Hitler in
08-01.description: On August 1, 1936, XI Summer Olympic Games are opened by Adolf Hitler in Berlin

08-02.title: The Beatles perform their first gig as the house band
08-02.description: On August 2, 1961, The Beatles perform their first gig as the house band at Liverpool's Cavern Club

08-03.title: Camila Cabello releases her single "Havana"
08-03.description: On August 3, 2017, Camila Cabello releases her single "Havana" (biggest song worldwide in 2018, 19 million copies sold)

08-04.title: Billboard Hot 100 is published for the first time with
08-04.description: On August 4, 1958, Billboard Hot 100 is published for the first time with "Poor Little Fool" by Ricky Nelson at #1

08-05.title: The Beatles release the single "Yellow Submarine" with
08-05.description: On August 5, 1966, The Beatles release the single "Yellow Submarine" with "Eleanor Rigby" in the UK

08-06.title: American punk rock band "The Ramones " performs for
08-06.description: On August 6, 1996, American punk rock band "The Ramones " performs for the last time at the Palace in Hollywood, California

08-07.title: Single "Tik Tok" is released by Kesha
08-07.description: On August 7, 2009, Single "Tik Tok" is released by Kesha (Billboard Song of the Year 2010)

08-08.description: On August 8, 1992, Metallica singer and guitarist James Hetfield suffers second and third-degree burns during a pyrotechnics explosion on stage at Olympic Stadium in Montreal

08-09.title: "Just to See You Smile" single released by Tim McGraw
08-09.description: On August 9, 1997, "Just to See You Smile" single released by Tim McGraw (Billboard Song of the Year 1998)

08-10.description: On August 10, 1787, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his chamber piece "Eine kleine Nachtmusik" (A Little Serenade)

08-11.description: On August 11, 1978, Second studio album by Chic, "C'est Chic," is released, featuring the single "Le Freak" (Billboard Album of the Year 1979)

08-12.description: On August 12, 1991, Heavy metal band Metallica releases its fifth album, "Metallica," which debuts at #1 on the Billboard 200 chart

08-13.description: On August 13, 2013, "Crash My Party," the fourth studio album by Luke Bryan, is released (Billboard Album of the Year 2014)

08-16.description: On August 16, 1974, American punk rock band "The Ramones " debut in concert at CBGB in New York City

08-19.description: On August 19, 2008, Interscope Records releases "The Fame," the debut album by Lady Gaga (Grammy Award for Best Electronic/Dance Album 2010)

08-20.description: On August 20, 1882, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky 's "1812 Overture" debuts in Moscow

08-21.title: "How You Remind Me" single released by Nickelback
08-21.description: On August 21, 2001, "How You Remind Me" single released by Nickelback (Billboard Song of the Year 2002)

08-22.title: Madonna 's single "Who's That Girl" hits #1
08-22.description: On August 22, 1987, Madonna 's single "Who's That Girl" hits #1

08-23.title: Jeff Buckley releases his album "Grace
08-23.description: On August 23, 1994, Jeff Buckley releases his album "Grace," featuring his cover of Leonard Cohen 's "Hallelujah"

08-24.title: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his violin and piano
08-24.description: On August 24, 1787, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his violin and piano sonata in A, K526

08-25.title: "The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill " debut album by
08-25.description: On August 25, 1998, "The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill " debut album by Lauryn Hill is released (5 Grammy Awards including Album of the Year, Billboard Album of the Year 1998)

08-26.title: "Hey Jude" single is released by the Beatles in the US
08-26.description: On August 26, 1968, "Hey Jude" single is released by the Beatles in the US (Billboard Song of the Year 1968, Billboard 10th biggest song of all time 2013)

08-27.title: The Beatles spend an evening with Elvis Presley at his
08-27.description: On August 27, 1965, The Beatles spend an evening with Elvis Presley at his Los Angeles, California, home

08-29.description: On August 29, 1958, Cliff Richard and the Drifters release their debut single "Move It," credited as the first British rock 'n' roll song

08-30.description: On August 30, 1968, The Beatles release the single "Hey Jude," their first record on their Apple label in the UK

08-31.description: On August 31, 1999, "Fly," the 5th studio album by the Dixie Chicks is released (Grammy Award Best Country Album 2000, Billboard Album of the Year 2000)

09-01.title: Mozart publishes his 6th String Quartet

09-02.title: Rod Stewart 's first #1 hit single in the UK
09-02.description: On September 2, 1972, Rod Stewart 's first #1 hit single in the UK, "You Wear It Well"

09-03.description: On September 3, 1912, Arnold Schoenberg 's "Fünf Orchesterstücke" (Five Pieces for Orchestra) premieres in London at a Promenade Concert

09-04.description: On September 4, 1965, The Beatles' single "Help!" goes to #1 and stays #1 for three weeks

09-05.description: On September 5, 2001, John Cage 's musical composition "As Slow as Possible", intended to be played for 639 years, begins at St. Burchardi Church, Halberstadt, Germany

09-06.description: On September 6, 1791, Wolfgang Mozart 's dramatic opera "La Clemenza di Tito" premieres at the Estates Theatre in Prague

09-07.description: On September 7, 1996, Rapper Tupac Shakur is shot multiple times in a drive-by shooting in Las Vegas and dies 6 days later

09-10.title: Rock band Nirvana releases their single "Smells Like
09-10.description: On September 10, 1991, Rock band Nirvana releases their single "Smells Like Teen Spirit," often dubbed the anthem of Generation X

09-11.title: Father of the Blues
09-11.description: On September 11, 1914, Father of the Blues, W. C. Handy, publishes "St. Louis Blues," his most famous composition

09-12.title: Gustav Mahler 's 8th Symphony "Symphony of a Thousand"
09-12.description: On September 12, 1910, Gustav Mahler 's 8th Symphony "Symphony of a Thousand" premieres in Munich with 1,028 musicians

09-14.title: George Frideric Handel finishes his "Messiah" oratorio

09-15.description: On September 15, 2005, "Be Without You" single is released by Mary J. Blige (Billboard Song of the Year 2006, Grammy Award for Best R&B Song, Best Female R&B Vocal Performance 2007)

09-17.description: On September 17, 1964, The Beatles are paid a record $150,000 by baseball team owner Charles Finley for a concert at Municipal Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, on a scheduled day off; the group adds the song "Kansas City"/"Hey, Hey, Hey, Hey" to their standard setlist, much to the delight of the crowd

09-18.title: The Royal Opera House opens in London
09-18.description: On September 18, 1809, The Royal Opera House opens in London

09-19.title: Chubby Checker's "The Twist" Hits #1
09-19.description: On September 19, 1960, The Twist Dance Craze 1960 Chubby Checker 's cover version of " The Twist " hits #1 on the Billboard Hot 100

09-20.description: On September 20, 1969, Virtual cartoon band The Archies' single "Sugar, Sugar" hits #1

09-21.description: On September 21, 2004, Green Day releases their album "American Idiot" in the US

09-23.title: "That'll Be the Day" single by Buddy Holly and The
09-23.description: On September 23, 1957, "That'll Be the Day" single by Buddy Holly and The Crickets reaches #1 in the US

09-24.title: Jailhouse Rock Premieres 1957 " Jailhouse Rock "
09-24.description: On September 24, 1957, Jailhouse Rock Premieres 1957 " Jailhouse Rock " single released by Elvis Presley (Billboard Song of the Year 1957)

09-25.description: On September 25, 1976, Bono, David Evans, his brother Dik, and Adam Clayton respond to an advertisement on a bulletin board at Mount Temple posted by fellow student Larry Mullen Jr. to form a rock band, which becomes U2

09-26.description: On September 26, 1969, Apple Records releases The Beatles' 11th studio album "Abbey Road," their final recordings as a quartet, topping the charts in eleven countries

09-27.title: W. C. Handy publishes "Memphis Blues
09-27.description: On September 27, 1912, W. C. Handy publishes "Memphis Blues," considered on of the first blues songs

09-28.title: The Beatles' single "Hey Jude" hits #1 and stays at #1
09-28.description: On September 28, 1968, The Beatles' single "Hey Jude" hits #1 and stays at #1 for nine weeks

09-29.title: "Let's Go Crazy" by Prince and Revolution
09-29.description: On September 29, 1984, "Let's Go Crazy" by Prince and Revolution, the second single from " Purple Rain " album, peaks at #1

09-30.title: Mozart 's opera "The Magic Flute
09-30.description: On September 30, 1791, Mozart 's opera "The Magic Flute," with a German libretto by Emanuel Schikaneder, premieres at Schikaneder's Freihaus-Theater auf der Wieden in Vienna, Austria

10-01.title: Marvin Gaye releases his last studio album "Midnight
10-01.description: On October 1, 1982, Marvin Gaye releases his last studio album "Midnight Love," featuring the single "Sexual Healing"

10-02.title: British band Oasis releases their second studio album
10-02.description: On October 2, 1995, British band Oasis releases their second studio album "(What's the Story) Morning Glory?" and sells a record 347,000 copies in the first week

10-03.title: New Zealand Natives
10-03.description: On October 3, 1888, New Zealand Natives, a privately organized and mainly Māori rugby team, play their first game in the UK and beat Surrey 4-1; they are the first national rugby team to wear all black and perform the haka

10-05.title: The Beatles release their first record, "Love Me Do"
10-05.description: On October 5, 1962, The Beatles release their first record, "Love Me Do"

10-06.title: Single "Faith" is released by George Michael
10-06.description: On October 6, 1987, Single "Faith" is released by George Michael (Billboard Song of the Year 1988)

10-07.title: Musical "Cats" opens at Winter Garden Theatre on
10-07.description: On October 7, 1982, Musical "Cats" opens at Winter Garden Theatre on Broadway, New York City, and runs for nearly 18 years, winning seven Tony Awards and a Grammy

10-08.description: On October 8, 1971, Apple Records releases John Lennon 's second solo studio album "Imagine" in the UK, and it tops the charts in the US, UK, Australia, and three other countries

10-09.description: On October 9, 1986, Stage musical "The Phantom of the Opera," written by Andrew Lloyd Webber and starring Michael Crawford and Sarah Brightman, premieres in London and runs for 13,629 performances

10-10.description: On October 10, 1969, "Jesus Christ Superstar" soundtrack album by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice is recorded

10-11.description: On October 11, 1983, "Can't Slow Down" second studio album by Lionel Richie is released

10-13.description: On October 13, 1966, Jimi Hendrix Experience rock trio debuts with American guitarist Jimi Hendrix, British bassist Noel Redding and British drummer Mitch Mitchell in Évreux, Normandy, France

10-13.title: American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan is named the
10-13.description: On October 13, 2016, American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan is named the recipient of the Nobel Prize in Literature

10-14.description: On October 14, 1991, NY Rangers right wing Mike Gartner becomes 1st NHL player to score his 500th goal, 500th assist, and 1000th point all in the same season

10-15.title: Debby Boone's single "You Light Up My Life" goes #1
10-15.description: On October 15, 1977, Debby Boone's single "You Light Up My Life" goes #1 and stays #1 for ten weeks

10-16.description: On October 16, 1912, Arnold Schoenberg 's "Pierrot Lunaire," sung by Albertine Zehme, premieres at the Berlin Choralion-Saal

10-17.title: The Beatles record "I Want to Hold Your Hand" at EMI
10-17.description: On October 17, 1963, The Beatles record "I Want to Hold Your Hand" at EMI Studios in London

10-18.title: First performance of Aaron Copland 's Third Symphony
10-18.description: On October 18, 1946, First performance of Aaron Copland 's Third Symphony by the Boston Symphony Orchestra led by Serge Koussevitzky, often called the "Great American Symphony"

10-19.title: Cher releases the single "Believe"
10-19.description: On October 19, 1999, Cher releases the single "Believe" (Billboard Song of the Year, 1999; Grammy Award Best Dance Recording, 2000)

10-20.description: On October 20, 1973, Sydney Opera House 1973 Queen Elizabeth II opens the Sydney Opera House at Bennelong Point in Sydney, Australia, after 14 years of construction

10-21.description: On October 21, 1858, Jacques Offenbach's operetta "Orpheus in the Underworld" (Orphée aux Enfers) premieres in Paris and includes "Infernal Galop" (can-can tune)

10-22.description: On October 22, 1883, New York's original Metropolitan Opera House has its grand opening with a performance of Charles Gounod 's opera "Faust"

10-23.title: Adele releases her single "Hello
10-23.description: On October 23, 2015, Adele releases her single "Hello," becomes the first song with more than a million downloads in its first week

10-24.description: On October 24, 1979, Guinness Book of Records presents Paul McCartney with a rhodium disc as the all-time best-selling singer-songwriter

10-25.description: On October 25, 1875, The first performance of the Piano Concerto No. 1 by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky is given in Boston, Massachusetts with Hans von Bülow as soloist

10-27.description: On October 27, 1960, American pop and soul singer Ben E. King records "Spanish Harlem" and "Stand By Me" in NYC

10-30.description: On October 30, 1944, Aaron Copland 's ballet score "Appalachian Spring" premieres at Coolidge Auditorium at the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C., with Martha Graham dancing the lead role [1]

10-31.description: On October 31, 1964, Barbra Streisand 's "People" album hits #1 and stays there for five weeks

11-01.description: On November 1, 1969, The Beatles' "Abbey Road" album goes #1 in the US and stays #1 for 11 weeks

11-02.title: "Thriller" single released worldwide by Michael Jackson
11-02.description: On November 2, 1983, "Thriller" single released worldwide by Michael Jackson

11-03.description: On November 3, 1992, "I Will Always Love You" ( Dolly Parton cover) single is released by Whitney Houston (Billboard Song of the Year 1993)

11-04.description: On November 4, 1876, Johannes Brahms ' 1st Symphony in C premieres in Karlsruhe, Grand Duchy of Baden

11-05.title: The rebuilt Vienna State Opera reopens after being
11-05.description: On November 5, 1955, The rebuilt Vienna State Opera reopens after being destroyed in World War II with Ludwig van Beethoven's "Fidelio"

11-06.title: First performance by punk band the Sex Pistols at St.
11-06.description: On November 6, 1975, First performance by punk band the Sex Pistols at St. Martin's College in London

11-07.title: The oldest performing musical organization in the
11-07.description: On November 7, 1786, The oldest performing musical organization in the United States is founded in Stoughton, Massachusetts, as the Stoughton Musical Society

11-08.title: Talking Revolution that Silenced Hollywood Stars 1926
11-08.description: On November 8, 1926, Talking Revolution that Silenced Hollywood Stars 1926 George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin, and P. G. Wodehouse 's musical "Oh, Kay!" opens at the Imperial Theatre in NYC and runs for 256 performances

11-08.title: Tenor Andrea Bocelli releases his "Sacred Arias" album
11-08.description: On November 8, 1999, Tenor Andrea Bocelli releases his "Sacred Arias" album, the world's best-selling classical album by a solo artist

11-09.title: First performance of the New York Symphony Orchestra
11-09.description: On November 9, 1878, First performance of the New York Symphony Orchestra, led by Leopold Damrosch; the group competes with the New York Philharmonic until merging in 1928

11-10.title: South Africa plays its first international cricket
11-10.description: On November 10, 1991, South Africa plays its first international cricket match since 1970, a one-day match against India

11-11.title: Louis Armstrong and his Hot Five begin their first
11-11.description: On November 11, 1925, Louis Armstrong and his Hot Five begin their first recording session at Okeh Records in Chicago

11-12.title: Robert Wright, George Forrest, and Maury Yeston's
11-12.description: On November 12, 1989, Robert Wright, George Forrest, and Maury Yeston's musical "Grand Hotel: The Musical" opens at the Martin Beck Theatre in NYC, runs for 1,018 performances, and wins five Tony Awards

11-12.title: LA judge rules to end Britney Spears ' conservatorship
11-12.description: On November 12, 2021, LA judge rules to end Britney Spears ' conservatorship, which had controlled almost all aspects of her life for 14 years

11-13.title: Eminem releases the single 'Lose Yourself' from the
11-13.description: On November 13, 2002, Eminem releases the single 'Lose Yourself' from the soundtrack of "8 Mile", the first rap song to win the Academy Award for Best Original Song

11-13.title: Kylie Minogue becomes the first woman to top the UK
11-13.description: On November 13, 2020, Kylie Minogue becomes the first woman to top the UK album chart over five consecutive decades with "Disco"

11-14.title: Ray Charles ' single "Georgia On My Mind" reaches #1
11-14.description: On November 14, 1960, Ray Charles ' single "Georgia On My Mind" reaches #1

11-15.title: Beastie Boys release their debut album "Licensed to Ill
11-15.description: On November 15, 1986, Beastie Boys release their debut album "Licensed to Ill," the first rap album to reach #1 on the Billboard charts

11-16.title: Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II 's musical
11-16.description: On November 16, 1959, Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II 's musical "The Sound of Music" by opens at the Lunt-Fontanne Theatre, NYC; runs for 1,443 performances

11-17.title: Britney Spears, at 21 years old, becomes the youngest
11-17.description: On November 17, 2003, Britney Spears, at 21 years old, becomes the youngest singer to get a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame

11-18.title: "The X Factor" group One Direction release their debut
11-18.description: On November 18, 2011, "The X Factor" group One Direction release their debut album "Up All Night" in Ireland and the UK

11-19.title: Pop duo Milli Vanilli are stripped of their Grammy
11-19.description: On November 19, 1990, Pop duo Milli Vanilli are stripped of their Grammy Award after it is learned they did not sing on their award-winning "Girl You Know It's True" album

11-20.title: Ludwig van Beethoven 's "Fidelio"
11-20.description: On November 20, 1805, Ludwig van Beethoven 's "Fidelio", his only opera, premieres at Vienna's Theater an der Wien

11-21.title: Dmitri Shostakovich 's 5th Symphony premieres in
11-21.description: On November 21, 1937, Dmitri Shostakovich 's 5th Symphony premieres in Leningrad, the ovation lasts for over an hour

11-22.title: RCA Records makes its best investment
11-22.description: On November 22, 1955, RCA Records makes its best investment, paying $35,000 to Sun Records for Elvis Presley 's contract

11-23.title: "Doggystyle," the debut album by Snoop Doggy Dogg, is
11-23.description: On November 23, 1993, "Doggystyle," the debut album by Snoop Doggy Dogg, is released (Billboard Album of the Year 1994)

11-24.title: Frank Loesser 's musical "Guys & Dolls
11-24.description: On November 24, 1950, Frank Loesser 's musical "Guys & Dolls," starring Robert Alda, Vivian Blaine, and Sam Levene, opens at 46th St Theater, NYC, and runs for 1,200 performances, winning five Tony Awards

11-25.title: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack"
11-25.description: On November 25, 2013, Disney releases "Frozen: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack" (Grammy Award for Best Compilation Soundtrack for Visual Media 2015, Billboard Album of the Year 2014)

11-26.title: Charlie "Bird" Parker leads a recording session with
11-26.description: On November 26, 1945, Charlie "Bird" Parker leads a recording session with Dizzy Gillespie and Miles Davis for the Savoy label, marketed as the "greatest jazz session ever"

11-27.title: The Beatles release their album "Magical Mystery Tour"
11-27.description: On November 27, 1967, The Beatles release their album "Magical Mystery Tour" in the US; issued as a double EP in the UK in December

11-28.title: Grand Ole Opry premieres as the WSM Barn Dance on WSM
11-28.description: On November 28, 1925, Grand Ole Opry premieres as the WSM Barn Dance on WSM Radio in Nashville, Tennessee

11-29.title: "Thriller," the sixth studio album by Michael Jackson
11-29.description: On November 29, 1982, "Thriller," the sixth studio album by Michael Jackson, is released (Grammy Award for Album of the Year 1984, best-selling album of all time, Billboard Album of the Year 1983)

11-29.title: Mary J. Blige releases "My Life
11-29.description: On November 29, 1994, Mary J. Blige releases "My Life," her second studio album (Billboard Music Award Top R&B Album 1995)

11-29.title: Taylor Swift is Spotify's most-streamed global artist
11-29.description: On November 29, 2023, Taylor Swift is Spotify's most-streamed global artist of the year with 26.1 billion streams, and "Flowers" by Miley Cyrus is the most-streamed song [1]

11-30.title: Pink Floyd 's album "The Wall" is released and sells
11-30.description: On November 30, 1979, Pink Floyd 's album "The Wall" is released and sells six million copies in two weeks

11-30.title: The Beatles release "Live at the BBC" in Britain
11-30.description: On November 30, 1994, The Beatles release "Live at the BBC" in Britain, their first album in 23 years

12-01.title: Franz Liszt, aged 11, debuts as a pianist in Vienna
12-01.description: On December 1, 1822, Franz Liszt, aged 11, debuts as a pianist in Vienna

12-02.title: Johannes Brahms ' "Symphony No. 3 in F major"
12-02.description: On December 2, 1883, Johannes Brahms ' "Symphony No. 3 in F major" premieres with the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra

12-03.title: Edward Elgar 's Symphony No. 1 in A is performed by
12-03.description: On December 3, 1908, Edward Elgar 's Symphony No. 1 in A is performed by the Hallé Orchestra, conducted by Hans Richter, premiering in Manchester, England

12-03.title: Spotify announces Drake as the most streamed star of
12-03.description: On December 3, 2019, Spotify announces Drake as the most streamed star of the 2010s with 28 billion streams, while Ed Sheeran 's "Shape of You" is the most streamed track with 2.4 billion streams

12-04.title: Duke Ellington opens at the Cotton Club in Harlem, NYC
12-04.description: On December 4, 1927, Duke Ellington opens at the Cotton Club in Harlem, NYC

12-05.title: Apple Records releases Paul McCartney and Wings' album
12-05.description: On December 5, 1973, Apple Records releases Paul McCartney and Wings' album "Band on the Run" in the US, the commercial and critical pinnacle of his post-Beatles work, topping the charts in seven countries

12-06.title: 300,000 attend a free concert featuring The Rolling
12-06.description: On December 6, 1969, 300,000 attend a free concert featuring The Rolling Stones in Altamont, California; the event is marred by violence and four deaths

12-07.title: American rock band The Grateful Dead break up after
12-07.description: On December 7, 1995, American rock band The Grateful Dead break up after the death of Jerry Garcia

12-08.title: Ludwig van Beethoven 's 7th Symphony in A major
12-08.description: On December 8, 1813, Ludwig van Beethoven 's 7th Symphony in A major premieres in Vienna, with Beethoven conducting

12-09.title: John Coltrane 's Quartet records its greatest work
12-09.description: On December 9, 1964, John Coltrane 's Quartet records its greatest work, "A Love Supreme," at Van Gelder Studio in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey

12-10.title: Bob Dylan is awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature at
12-10.description: On December 10, 2016, Bob Dylan is awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden; he does not attend

12-11.title: Hank Williams begins recording for the Sterling
12-11.description: On December 11, 1946, Hank Williams begins recording for the Sterling Records label

12-12.title: In Vienna, 22-year-old Ludwig van Beethoven receives
12-12.description: On December 12, 1792, In Vienna, 22-year-old Ludwig van Beethoven receives his first lesson in music composition from 60-year-old Franz Joseph Haydn

12-13.title: First music store in America opens in Philadelphia by
12-13.description: On December 13, 1759, First music store in America opens in Philadelphia by future Treasurer of the United States, Michael Hillegas

12-14.title: First chamber music group in the US gives its first
12-14.description: On December 14, 1849, First chamber music group in the US gives its first concert in Boston, Massachusetts

12-15.title: "Folsom Prison Blues" single released by Johnny Cash
12-15.description: On December 15, 1955, "Folsom Prison Blues" single released by Johnny Cash (Billboard Song of the Year 1968)

12-16.title: Antonín Dvořák 's Symphony No. 9 "From the New World"
12-16.description: On December 16, 1893, Antonín Dvořák 's Symphony No. 9 "From the New World" premieres at Carnegie Hall in New York City

12-17.title: Franz Schubert 's Symphony No. 8
12-17.description: On December 17, 1865, Franz Schubert 's Symphony No. 8, "Unfinished Symphony", premieres in Vienna with Johann von Herbeck conducting

12-18.title: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky 's ballet "The Nutcracker"
12-18.description: On December 18, 1892, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky 's ballet "The Nutcracker" premieres in Saint Petersburg, Russia, now the world's most performed ballet; his final opera "Isolanta" also premieres

12-19.title: Frank Sinatra 's first recording session with Reprise
12-19.description: On December 19, 1960, Frank Sinatra 's first recording session with Reprise Records, recording "Ring-a-Ding-Ding" and "Let's Fall in Love"

12-20.title: Play "Rosamunde, Princess of Cyprus" by Helmina von
12-20.description: On December 20, 1823, Play "Rosamunde, Princess of Cyprus" by Helmina von Chézy with incidental music by Franz Schubert premieres in Vienna

12-21.title: Glen Campbell 's album "Wichita Lineman" reaches #1 in
12-21.description: On December 21, 1968, Glen Campbell 's album "Wichita Lineman" reaches #1 in the US

12-22.title: Claude Debussy 's first orchestral masterpiece
12-22.description: On December 22, 1894, Claude Debussy 's first orchestral masterpiece "Prélude à l'après-midi d'un faune" (Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun) premieres in Paris

12-23.title: Opera "Hansel and Gretel" by Engelbert Humperdinck and
12-23.description: On December 23, 1893, Opera "Hansel and Gretel" by Engelbert Humperdinck and his sister Adelheid Wette premieres in Weimar, conducted by Richard Strauss

12-24.title: Giuseppe Verdi 's opera "Aida" premieres in Cairo
12-24.description: On December 24, 1871, Giuseppe Verdi 's opera "Aida" premieres in Cairo, Egypt

12-25.title: Patriotic march "The Stars and Stripes Forever" is
12-25.description: On December 25, 1896, Patriotic march "The Stars and Stripes Forever" is composed by John Philip Sousa

12-26.title: Jimi Hendrix writes the song "Purple Haze" backstage
12-26.description: On December 26, 1966, Jimi Hendrix writes the song "Purple Haze" backstage at the Upper Cut Club in London

12-27.title: Radio City Music Hall
12-27.description: On December 27, 1932, Radio City Music Hall, designed by Edward Durell Stone and Donald Deskey, opens at Rockefeller Center in Manhattan, New York City

12-28.title: Leonard Bernstein
12-28.description: On December 28, 1944, Leonard Bernstein, Betty Comden, and Adolph Green 's musical "On the Town" with choreography by Jerome Robbins, opens at the Adelphi Theatre, NYC; runs for 462 performances

12-29.title: Scott Joplin copyrights "The Entertainer" and several
12-29.description: On December 29, 1902, Scott Joplin copyrights "The Entertainer" and several other piano rag compositions with the US Copyright Office

12-30.title: Frank Sinatra records "My Way" for the first time
12-30.description: On December 30, 1968, Frank Sinatra records "My Way" for the first time, based on the French song "Comme d'habitude" with lyrics by Paul Anka

12-31.title: Largest free concert in the world occurs when Rod
12-31.description: On December 31, 1994, Largest free concert in the world occurs when Rod Stewart performs in front of an estimated 3.5 million people at Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil [1]
